title: Immunizations Clinic
description: The official website for Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune
cleaned_text: Clinic is located in the main Medical Center across from Family Medicine on the first floor. The NMCCL Immunizations Clinic focuses on immunizations for beneficiaries such as family members of active duty and retirees. Active Duty personnel should speak with their Battalion Aid Station (BAS) or Marine Centered Medical Home (MCMH) clinic about immunizations before presenting to the NMCCL Immunizations Clinic. Please note: The last patient of the day will be seen 15 minutes prior to close of business. Immunization Records For your immunizations records, please logon to the [ MHS GENESIS Patient Portal](https://myaccess.dmdc.osd.mil/identitymanagement/app/login) . Flu Vaccines Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune is waiting on our annual shipment of the influenza vaccine, but you don't have to wait to get the flu shot! You are able to get your vaccine off-base if you visit a TRICARE-approved pharmacy! Use this [search tool](https://militaryrx.express-scripts.com/find-pharmacy) to find a TRICARE-approved pharmacy near you in Eastern North Carolina. - In accordance with Defense Health Agency policy, flu vaccines can be given to TRICARE beneficiaries and health care personnel. NMCCL can only give the flu vaccine to GS, NAF, or DODEA employees if they are also a TRICARE beneficiary or health care personnel. - TRICARE beneficiaries may receive the flu vaccine at no cost if you use a pharmacy within the network. - For more information about TRICARE's coverage of flu shots and where to find a network pharmacy visit: [https://tricare.mil/CoveredServices/IsItCovered/FluVaccine.](https://tricare.mil/CoveredServices/IsItCovered/FluVaccine.) COVID-19 Vaccines NMCCL offers the Pfizer Bivalent Booster, one of two FDA-authorized boosters for emergency use; may be given after completion of primary series with any monovalent product. Beneficiaries 12 Years and Older - Walk ins WHO: Eligible TRICARE-eligible beneficiaries ages 12 and older, DoD employees WHAT: NMCCL offers the Pfizer Bivalent Booster, one of two FDA-authorized boosters for emergency use; may be given after completion of primary series with any monovalent product. WHERE: Naval Medical Center Camp Lejeune Immunizations Clinic (First Floor) WHEN: Tuesdays ONLY 8 a.m.-12:30 p.m. & 1-4 p.m. NOTE: If you choose to have your child vaccinated off the installation, you will need to bring a record of the vaccination to the NMCCL Immunizations Clinic for updating your child's health record. ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY - Walk ins WHO: Active Duty Military only WHAT: Pfizer Bivalent booster ONLY WHERE & WHEN: Tuesdays: MCB Camp Lejeune, Marine Centered Medical Home (MCMH) Hadnot Point, 165 I Street, 8:30-10:00 a.m. Wednesdays: Camp Geiger Branch Medical Clinic, 775 E Street, 8:30 - 10:00 a.m.
